intro: Cryptantha muricata var. genuina, commonly known as the roughleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
